question: 鳴き声
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>chirp</kanji> <kanji>voice</kanji> is a sound an animal makes. Sure, it works for birds (which chirp), but it also works with most other animals as well. So, we call this an <vocabulary>animal cry</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are those that you learned with the kanji. <ja>声</ja> gets changed to <ja>ごえ</ja>, though, so take note of that in your head. Perhaps you can imagine an animal that does a "GOEEEEE" cry.
